info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 7 at 1:49PM EDT until October 8 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding during times of high tide. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents.
* WHERE...Coastal Flagler, Northeast Coastal St. Johns and Southeast Coastal St. Johns Counties.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 8 PM EDT Wednesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Wednesday night.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT

area.areaDesc: Coastal Flagler; Northeast Coastal St. Johns; Southeast Coastal St. Johns
